Dear Christy Shillings:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation 1: The evening of 5/10/24 Staff 1 arranged for adults
to beat Youth M outside the building while unidentified staff
witnessed.
Allegation 2: Staff 1 was observed drinking on the job.
Investigation I was assigned this investigation on 5/13/24. The complainant is
anonymous.
Regarding Staff 1 or others drinking on the job, this was
investigated in SIR 2024SIC0001300 dated 5/8/24 and there was
no evidence to support it.
Interviews:
Government Worker 2 checked Youth M’s well-being on 5/10/24
and took photos of his face.
I notified Youth M’s Foster Care Worker of the investigation
assignment. She expressed no licensing concerns pertaining to
Wolverine Center.
I contacted Chief Administrator (CA) on 5/13/24. She said she
was not in the building when Youth M returned from AWOL on
5/10/24 and informed staff he was assaulted by someone. CA
was not aware of any injuries. However, the youth was seen at
the emergency room that night and reported the assault to law
enforcement. CA was unaware if anyone witnessed the assault in
the street.
I scheduled staff interviews in collaboration with Government
Worker.
I interviewed Supervisor jointly with Government Worker on
5/17/24. He has worked at the facility for seven months.
Supervisor said it was reported that Youth M assaulted a youth
2

who functions at a much younger age than himself, so Supervisor
called 911. “Youth M stormed out the exit door and I followed him.
He picked up bricks. I redirected him. He walked up Lenox to
Charlevoix. He was in the street with bricks in his hands. I
returned to the front of the building and watched him from a
distance down the street. Youth M walked back toward the
Wolverine property. I saw a car coming down the street real fast.
The car stopped in front of the building and two guys jumped out.
I’m not sure if they had a weapon or not. I didn’t want to break it
up and risk getting stabbed. One man threw punches at Youth M.
Youth M curled into a fetal position…I could not see the age of the
man. It was dark…The men did not say anything…It was a black
sedan.”
Supervisor was asked why men in a car might want to assault
Youth M. He answered, “If I was to guess, Youth M threw a brick
and that car panicked.” Supervisor said the only witnesses to the
assault were him and Staff 1. Government Worker asked
Supervisor if he had any concerns relative to Staff 1. He said he
had no concerns.
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker on 5/17/24.
She has worked at the facility for over a year. Government
Worker read the allegations aloud. Staff 1 said Youth M
reportedly assaulted a youth on the third floor and the youth was
crying. “Supervisor called 911 for the assault. Youth M left the
floor and the building. He paced outdoors with bricks in his hand.
Youth M walked down the street to Charlevoix. I stayed outside in
front of the building. Youth M yelled out to cars passing by and
went out of my view. He made it back and a black car stopped. I
saw two guys pull up. Supervisor and I moved away…I was
scared.” Asked if Staff 1 knew the men in the car, she answered,
“No. It could’ve been a car he was cussing at.” She denied
saying anything to Youth M related to the men in the car. “I saw
Youth M afterward for a second and saw no marks.”
Staff 1 said she knows the identity of the anonymous complainant.
“There’s one staff (Staff 2) who complains about everything I
do…We dated for a short period of time,” she added.
I interviewed Youth M jointly with Government Worker on 5/17/24.
On his unit, he said he had an altercation with a “slow kid” and
walked off the unit and out of the building without permission.
Outside he said, “Staff 1 was trippin’ and I was cussin’.” Staff 1
remarked that “I had better hope ‘they’ get here soon.” Youth M
did not know who Staff 1 was referring to as ‘they.’ Youth M said
3

he walked up the street to the next road. He denied he had
picked up bricks and denied carrying them in his hands or cussing
at vehicles. “I walked back (to the front of the building). A black
Malibu pulled up and two dudes hopped out. Staff 1 pointed to me
and said, “That’s the kid.” Youth M said both men got out of the
car and hit him. “I got on the ground and covered my face. They
got in the car and left. I told Staff 1, “You know you’re wrong for
that.” I asked him why Staff 1 did something wrong. He said,
“Because she called them.” I asked why he thinks she called the
men. “I don’t think it’s a coincidence since she said earlier, I
better hope ‘they’ get here soon…I told everybody that Staff 1 had
people beat me up.”
Documents reviewed:
Photos taken by Government Worker 1 of Youth M’s face show ¼
“scratches above his left eyebrow and above his left upper jaw
with discoloration below his left eye.
Discharge instructions from Beaumont Grosse Point Hospital
dated 5/10/24 indicate Youth M was assaulted by an unknown
person. His arm, hands and legs were x-rayed. He was
diagnosed with contusion of the right upper extremity and
periorbital ecchymosis of the left eye and treated with Ibuprofen.
An incident report by Supervisor dated 5/10/24 at 9:40pm
indicated while Youth M was outdoors without permission, he
picked up two bricks and walked up the street toward Charlevoix.
Supervisor redirected youth to put the bricks down and return to
the building, but Youth M kept walking and started playing in the
middle of Charlevoix. Supervisor returned to the building to wait
for police who he called for Youth M’s assault on a youth on the
third floor. Supervisor witnessed a car pull up, and males jumped
out and attacked Youth M. Supervisor was already waiting for
911, but they never showed. A body chart completed on 5/10/24
at 9:40pm showed no visible marks on Youth M at that time.
Government Worker had no findings.
Analysis It was concluded that if Staff 1 told Youth M he had “better hope
they get here soon,” she was referring to 911 as Supervisor had
called them and she and Supervisor were waiting for the ‘them’ to
arrive. Staff 1 and Supervisor denied that Staff 1 pointed the
youth out to the men who pulled up in the car. Staff 1 denied
knowing or arranging for the men to assault Youth M outdoors in
front of the facility.
4

This incident was reported to law enforcement. If law enforcement
is able to identify the men who assaulted Youth M and one or both
are related to or associated with Staff 1, this portion of the
investigation will be reopened, and an addendum will be
completed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 admitted using discriminatory language toward Youth M
and being suspended for three days.
Investigation Interview:
Staff 1 stated “Youth M said stuff to me, and I responded in the
wrong way and reported myself…I called him a ho-ass ‘n-word’
out of frustration, called CA and punched out.”
Document reviewed:
I reviewed an Employee Counseling Form dated 5/10/24 that
confirmed Staff 1 was suspended for three days on 5/11/24,
5/13/24 and 5/14/24 for inappropriate communication toward
Youth M.
Analysis Staff 1 admitted using discriminatory language toward Youth M.
Conclusion Violation Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
